intro: Seriola aethnensis f. melanotrycha, commonly known as the dark-hairfin seriola, is a rare botanical variant of the seriola genus. It is characterized by its distinctive dark, wiry foliage that sets it apart from other forms of the species. This plant thrives in specific microhabitats, typically in shaded, moist environments with rich organic soil. Its leaves are narrow and elongated, with a dense arrangement of dark-green, thread-like veins. The plant exhibits a unique reproductive strategy, producing small, clustered flowers that attract specific pollinators.
